8 whole chicken legs

Ingredients For Roasted Chicken And Potatoes:

10 sprigs fresh rosemary
3 large red-skin garlic cloves
1.75 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes
2 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

Instructions For Marinade:

1. Wash and thinly slice lemons, oranges and garlic. Melt 4 tablespoons of butter over low heat in a sauce pan. Add apple vinegar, oranges, garlic, lemon juice and one tablespoon of the lemon zest into saucepan, and stir. Add chicken to marinade and allow chicken to marinate over night, or for up to 24 hours.
2. Put 3 tablespoons of butter into a sauce pan over medium heat and add chopped rosemary leaves. Stir rosemary with butter. Strain rosemary butter and put butter back into saucepan. Stir in 1.5 cups of white wine, the remaining tablespoon of lemon zest, pepper, rosemary and lemon slices. This creates rosemary-lemon butter sauce.

Instructions For Roasted Chicken And Potatoes:

1. Add rosemary-lemon butter sauce to marinated chicken legs before roasting in the oven. Peel and slice potatoes and add potatoes to rosemary-lemon butter sauce. Stir. Transfer potatoes and chicken to a roasting pan using a slotted spoon. Add rosemary sprigs and roast in 375-degree oven.

2. Drain excess rosemary-lemon butter sauce and roast until chicken is cooked, approximately one hour. Season chicken with salt and pepper.

5 medium potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 tablespoon butter or margarine divided
3 eggs beaten
2 slices cooked bacon chopped
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese (optional) salt and pepper to taste
Place the potato in enough water to cover it by 1 inch; bring it to boil in a saucepan, reduce heat, and cook at a simmer until fork tender; drain; cool slightly then cut one large X through the top of each potato skin.
With a spoon push some of the filling toward the interior edge of the skin to make room for egg yolks; reserve filling that has been scooped out with skins of remaining potatoes for filling while still warm. Cut up bacon into small pieces.
In non-stick pan fry eggs in 1 tsp of margarine until almost firm but not yet dry, folding constantly so they are scrambled. Add half of reserved mashed potatoes and stir thoroughly over moderate heat until hot.
Sprinkle mixture lightly with salt, pepper, and cheese if desired, and stuff this mixture into first hollowed out potato shell. Reserve balance of mix to fill second hollowed potato. Mix second batch of eggs as above adding half of mashed contents of remaining potatoes filling and putting mixture back into next hollow potato.
Stuff both halves evenly using remaining cooked bacon in same manner repeating mixing procedure for final potato. Continue making potatoes in similar fashion alternating steps for potatoes according to number you intend to serve and heating them thoroughly before serving. Yield should be one potato half per person so five people normally can get three quarters of these if served for luncheon with soup or salad etc.

To make the stock… In a stockpot, heat water over high heat until boiling; add chicken breasts and cook a few minutes only, just enough to start poaching . Remove with tongs and put immediately onto cutting board, dice finely after it cools down slightly Add about one teaspoon kosher salt to the pot and bring to a rolling boil again. Cook about half of each vegetable first (celery and carrot), just to barely soften them, so they aren’t too mushy later on once you throw everything together; remove with a ladle carefully, putting aside separately from each other on paper towels . Then place rest of vegetables directly into simmering broth while cooking for ten minutes longer. Reduce heat if veggies seem like floating everywhere – adjust temperature accordingly. Stir occassionally. When done allow soup skimming any scum from top occasionally & letting set for ten to fifteen minutes or so, without keeping uncovered , then fish out with flat slotted spoon so no greasy stuff gets back into liquid when returning cooked pasta shells etc . Strain thru mesh sieve saving most of vegetables but discarding fibrous

This is just one example of the creative process at cooking websites. This recipe does call for seasonings and a cooking time (12 minutes) but the instructions are not detailed and seem to be tailored for the adventurous. There is also the potential for human error, the cook making substitutions and not realizing that the substitution should be made. There's room for error and not a lot of information. If you search the site for "Savory Lamb Patties" you'll get no results because the system looks at the recipe as a whole and determines the search word is not present. Also, the site doesn't have a way of searching just by recipe part (ingredient list, directions and so on). Sites like this require users to know the specific dish they're looking for, as opposed to a meal they want to make using ingredients in their cupboard.

In the next section, we'll take a look at a recipe service that gets around some of these problems.

Ingredients:
1 cup water
4 tablespoons butter, cubed
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup all-purpose flour
3 eggs
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper
Directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. In a medium saucepan over high heat, combine water, butter and salt; bring to a boil. Stir in flour until mixture forms a ball. Remove from heat; let stand for 5 minutes. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in cheese and pepper. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in preheated oven, or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Ingredients: 1 (8 pound) fully cooked ham, bone-in and shank end removed
2 cups brown sugar
3/4 cup honey mustard salad dressing
Directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place ham in a roasting pan with cut side down. In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar and honey mustard until well blended; spread over top of ham. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for about 2 hours, or until heated through. Remove from oven, cover loosely with foil, and let stand for 15 minutes before slicing.

"You didn't really think about what 'colored' means or perhaps how it might sound to someone who is not white?" one commenter wrote. "Or was it just another mistake that you made while writing the recipe?"

2 cups water or non-alcoholic white wine
1 (18 ounce) bottle of your favorite Caribbean Mojito-style beer
2 pounds of pork shoulder (or similar cut of pork)
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
2 cloves garlic, minced
Juice from 1 small lime
2 sprigs fresh rosemary leaves
2 sprigs fresh thyme leaves
Salt and pepper to taste
3 tablespoons Dijon mustard
4 tablespoons butter

Pour the water (or non-alcoholic wine) and Mojito-style beer into a slow cooker. Add the pork. Add the lemon juice, garlic, lime juice, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper, and mustard. Mix well. Cover the slow cooker and cook on the slow setting for 6 to 8 hours.

When the pork is finished cooking, remove it from the slow cooker. Turn the heat on the slow cooker up to high and remove the liquids using a slotted spoon.

Turn the heat on the slow cooker up to high. In a skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Quickly brown the pork chops on both sides. Once they are browned on both sides, place the pork chops into a slow cooker.

In the skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Mix in the 4 tablespoons of flour. Cook for about three minutes, stirring frequently. Slowly stir in the liquid that was drained from the slow cooker. Cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce is thickened. Pour the sauce over the pork chops.

Serve with rice or pasta.

2 1/2 lbs. tomatillos, husked
4 cloves garlic, peeled
2 chile jalapeno, seeded (or 1 chile ancho)
2 tsp. salt, or more to taste
1/4 t. ground cumin
3 tbsps. chopped fresh cilantro

Place tomatillos, garlic and chile peppers into a large pot. Cover with water, and bring just to a rolling boil over medium-high heat. Remove from the heat, and let cool for 10 minutes.
Pour the contents of the pot (including the water) into a food processor. Blend until smooth. Process in the salt, cumin, and cilantro. Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt or cumin, if desired. Refrigerate salsa for at least 1 hour before serving.

The recipe is one of 9 salsa recipes currently listed on the site. My all time favorite is a salsa verde — salsa de tomatillo — from an old cookbook. The key to this recipe is to only include the very best tasting tomatillos. If you've ever made salsa before and it was a bad batch — the culprit was probably that not-so-delicious can of Rotel, or a few mediocre tomatoes. I've found out that tomatillos should be tasted even before taking the husk off.

So here is a quick guide on how to pick good tomatillos:

1. Peel off a few of the tomatillos and see if the sticky film has washed off, if it hasn't, then they're probably under-ripe.

2. See if the tomatillos are of a darker green color

3. Squeeze. Like tomatoes, if they give slightly and aren't too firm, then they're ripe enough.

Aside from tasting and looking good, tomatillos are great because of their versatility. I had a good friend who was once afraid or intimidated by this

Ingredients
- 1 cup almond flour
- 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease donut pan or line with paper liners. In a medium bowl, mix together almond flour, coconut oil, eggs, salt and baking soda until smooth. Stir in honey and vanilla. Fill each donut cavity about halfway. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Cool before removing from pan.

Amish Friendship Cake Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 3 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts or pecans

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Stir in the vanilla extract, milk, sour cream, applesauce, raisins, and nuts.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool completely in the baking dish before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Amish Friendship Cake! This recipe makes a great gift for a friend or family member, as it can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. Simply let it come to room temperature before serving.

Pannacotta with Blueberry Coulis Recipe
Ingredients: 
For the pannacotta:
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1 cup whole milk
- 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 large egg yolks

For the blueberry coulis:
- 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice

Instructions:

1. To make the pannacotta, heat the heavy cream, whole milk, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat until the mixture comes to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the vanilla extract.

2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks until they are pale yellow in color. Slowly pour the hot cream mixture into the egg yolks, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from cooking. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until it thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon.

3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool to room temperature. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into an ovenproof dish or individual ramekins. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight until set.

4. While the pannacotta is setting, make the blueberry coulis. Place the blueberries, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the berries break down and the mixture becomes syrupy, about 10-15 minutes.

5. Once the pannacotta has set, remove it from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature for about 10 minutes before serving. Run a knife around the edge of the dish to loosen the pannacotta, then carefully turn it onto a plate. Spoon the blueberry coulis over the top of the pannacotta and serve immediately. Enjoy!

Portobello Mushrooms on Tomato Basil Fettuccini Recipe
Ingredients: 
- 8 large portobello mushrooms, cleaned and sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 pound fettuccini pasta
- 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- Fresh parsley or basil for garnish

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Toss the portobello mushroom slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl until evenly coated. Spread them out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and caramelized.

2. Meanwhile, cook the fettuccini pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta and set aside.

3. In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the minced garlic for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add the halved cherry tomatoes and chopped fresh basil to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for about 10 minutes more, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have released their juice and created a sauce.

4. To assemble the dish, toss the cooked fettuccini pasta with the tomato basil sauce until well combined. Serve the pasta in individual bowls and top each serving with a couple of roasted portobello mushrooms and some grated Parmesan cheese. Garnish with fresh parsley or basil if desired before serving. Enjoy!

Classic Buttermilk Biscuits (Nytimes)

Ingredients:

* 2 cups all-purpose flour
* 1 tablespoon baking powder
* 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
* 1/2 teaspoon salt
* 1/2 cup unsalted butter, chilled and cut into small pieces
* 3/4 cup buttermilk
* 1 large egg

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
3. Add the chilled butter to the dry ingredients and using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the mixture until it forms pea-sized crumbs.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and egg. Pour this mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
5. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently until it comes together, about 2 minutes.
6. Roll the dough out to about 1/2 inch thickness. Using a biscuit cutter, cut out the biscuits and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown.
8. Serve warm with your favorite toppings, such as honey, jam or butter. Enjoy!

Pasta Vesuviana is a classic Italian pasta dish that is both simple and delicious. This recipe serves 4 people.

Ingredients:
- 1 pound spaghetti
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish

Instructions:

1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until it is al dente. Drain and set aside.

2. While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.

3. Add the crushed tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper to the saucepan. Stir well to combine.

4. Bring the sauce to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened.

5. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and toss well to coat.

6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the grated Parmesan cheese.

7. Serve the pasta immediately, garnished with fresh parsley. Enjoy!

Salted Roast Turkey With Herbs Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 (14-16 pound) fresh turkey
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature
- 1 tablespoon kosher salt
- 1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1 teaspoon dried sage
- 1 lemon, quartered
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup chicken broth

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (218°C). Rinse the turkey inside and out with cold water and pat dry with paper towels.

2. In a small bowl, mix together the butter, kosher salt, pepper, thyme, rosemary, and sage.

3. Using your fingers, loosen the skin on the back of the turkey and rub the butter mixture all over the meat, under the skin.

4. Place the turkey in a roasting pan, breast-side up. Tuck the wings behind the back.

5. Add the lemon quarters and minced garlic to the roasting pan.

6. Pour the chicken broth into the roasting pan, making sure not to pour it over the turkey.

7. Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil and roast the turkey in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes per pound, or about 2 hours and 15 minutes.

8. Remove the aluminum foil and continue to roast for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the skin is crispy and golden brown.

9. Remove the turkey from the oven and let it rest for at least 30 minutes before carving.

10. Discard the garlic and lemon from the roasting pan. Carve the turkey and serve with your favorite herbs and spices.

Enjoy your delicious Salted Roast Turkey With Herbs!

Millionaires Shortbread Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- pinch of salt
- 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips
- 1 cup sweetened condensed milk

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8x8 inch square baking pan with parchment paper.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, and butter. Mix until the dough comes together, then press it evenly into the prepared baking pan.
3. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the base is golden brown.
4. Remove from the oven and sprinkle chocolate chips over the warm base. 
5. Pour sweetened condensed milk over the chocolate chips, making sure to cover them completely.
6. Return the pan to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the top is set and lightly golden.
7. Allow the Millionaires Shortbread to cool completely before cutting into squares and serving. 
Enjoy your delicious, homemade Millionaires Shortbread!

Fusilli with Rapini (Broccoli Rabe), Garlic, and Tomato Wine Sauce Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 pound fusilli pasta
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bunch of rapini (broccoli rabe), trimmed and chopped into bite-sized pieces
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup white wine
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- Fresh basil leaves, torn

Instructions:

1. Cook the fusilli according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about one minute or until fragrant.
3. Add the chopped rapini to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the rapini is tender but still has some crunch.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes or until they start to soften.
5. Pour in the white wine and stir well to combine with the vegetables. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it reduce for about 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. Add the cooked fusilli to the skillet and toss everything together until the pasta is coated with the sauce.
7. Serve the fusilli with rapini, garlic, and tomato wine sauce hot, garnished with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and torn basil leaves. Enjoy!

Fresh Tuna Salad Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 lb fresh, sushi-grade tuna
- ¼ cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 small shallot, finely chopped
- 2 stalks celery, thinly sliced
- ½ cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 4 cups mixed greens
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Begin by preparing the tuna. Using a sharp knife, slice it into thin, even strips against the grain. Place the tuna in a bowl and set aside.

2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, and shallot until well combined.

3. Pour the dressing over the tuna and toss gently to coat. Allow the tuna to marinate in the dressing for about 5 minutes while you prepare the vegetables.

4. Add the celery, cherry tomatoes, and mixed greens to the bowl with the tuna. Toss everything together until well combined.

5. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator before serving. Enjoy your delicious and healthy Fresh Tuna Salad!

St. Joseph's Day Bread Recipe

Ingredients:

* 3 cups all-purpose flour
* 1 tablespoon sugar
* 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
* 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
* 1 1/2 cups warm water
* 1/4 cup vegetable oil

Instructions:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
2. Add the warm water and vegetable oil to the dry ingredients and mix until a soft dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm, draft-free place for about 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and shape it into a round loaf.
6. Place the loaf in a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan and let it rise again for about 30 minutes, or until it has nearly doubled in size.
7. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
8. Bake the bread for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
9. Remove the bread from the pan and let it cool on a wire rack for at least 30 minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious St. Joseph's Day Bread!

Ingredients for the cabbage and mushroom galette:

* 1 pre-made puff pastry sheet, defrosted
* 2 tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
* 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
* Salt and pepper to taste
* 3 cups thinly sliced cabbage
* 1 lb. sliced cremini mushrooms
* 2 cloves garlic, minced

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a small bowl, mix together parsley, Parmesan, salt, and pepper until combined. Spoon this mixture onto the center of the puff pastry sheet and spread it out into an even layer.
3. Arrange the cabbage leaves on top of the herb and cheese mixture, starting from one corner of the puff pastry and working your way toward the other

Here's a simple recipe for a delicious Meat and Vegetable pie:

Ingredients:

* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* 1 onion, chopped

DILL PICKLES BY THE JAR
Recipe: 

Ingredients:
- Fresh cucumbers (4-5 medium sized)
- Fresh dill weed (1 bunch)
- Garlic cloves (2 large)
- White vinegar (3 cups)
- Water (1 cup)
- Sugar (1 tablespoon)
- Salt (1 teaspoon)
- Mustard seeds (1 teaspoon)
- Red pepper flakes (pinch)
- Large glass jars or sterilized canning jars with lids

Instructions:

1. Start by washing the fresh cucumbers thoroughly under running water. Cut off the ends of each cucumber and slice them into desired shape – spears, rounds or slices.

2. Sterilize your glass jars in hot oven or boiling water for at least 10 minutes to remove any bacteria. Make sure the jars are completely dry before using them.

3. In a large bowl, combine sliced cucumbers, chopped garlic, fresh dill weed, mustard seeds and red pepper flakes.

4. In a separate saucepan, heat white vinegar, sugar, salt and water over medium heat until sugar dissolves completely. Bring the mixture to a rolling boil.

5. Pour the hot vinegar mixture over the cucumbers and stir well to coat all the vegetables evenly.

6. Carefully transfer the vegetable mixture into the sterilized jars, leaving about ½ inch space from the top of the jar.

7. Seal the jars tightly with their respective lids and let them cool down to room temperature.

8. Once the jars have reached room temperature, store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator. The pickles will be ready to eat after 24 hours but they taste best when left to ferment for several weeks.

9. Enjoy your homemade dill pickles as a snack, side dish or ingredient in sandwiches and salads. You can also share

Spaghetti with black truffle sauce is a classic dish of the Umbrian cuisine in Italy, particularly from the famous region of Perugia. The dish features fresh spaghetti noodles served with an aromatic and rich black truffle oil, accompanied by sautéed spinach and garlic, and sometimes grated Pecorino Romano cheese. To make this delicious pasta dish at home, you will need the following ingredients:

Ingredients:

* 1 pound dried or fresh spaghetti noodles
* 3-4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
* 2 cloves of minced garlic
* 5 cups washed and stemmed spinach leaves, chopped into small pieces
* Salt to taste
* Ground black pepper to taste
* Shaved aged cured ham or prosciutto, for garnish (optional)
* Grated Pecorino Romano cheese (also known as Parmigiano Reggianito), for serving

For the black truffule sauce:

* 2 cups sliced norcia black truffles in water
* 1 can whole peeled plum tomatoes with juice, drained
* 1 onion finely chopped
* Olive oil as needed
* White wine as needed
* Fresh basil leaves, chopped
* Salt to taste

Instructions:

1. First, prepare the black truffle sauce. In a medium-sized pot, heat some olive oil over medium-low heat, then add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent. Add a splash of white wine if the onions appear too dry.
2. Drain the canned plum tomatoes and chop them up into smaller pieces, adding them into the pot with the onion. Cook for about 5 minutes.
3. While the sauce is cooking, strain the sliced black truffles keeping their soaking liquid aside (this will be used later). Chop the black truffles into fine pieces.
4. Add Black truffulae black truffles , chopped to the saucepan. Season with salt

Ingredients:
- 1 cup heavy cream, divided
- 4 large egg yolks
- 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 6 oz semi-sweet chocolate, chopped
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Whipped cream and sliced strawberries (optional toppings)

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease four ramekins or heatproof cups with cooking spray or butter.
2. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together ½ cup of heavy cream, sugar, and cornstarch until smooth. Cook mixture, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in chopped chocolate and vanilla extract until well combined.
3. Divide the chocolate mixture evenly among the prepared ramekins. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until set around the edges but still slightly jiggly in the center.
4. Remove from oven and let cool at room temperature for a few minutes before chilling in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. To serve, run warm water around the base of each ramekin to loosen the pudding, then carefully invert onto individual plates. Top with whipped cream and sliced strawberries if desired. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 6 cups fresh spinach leaves, washed and chopped
- 1/2 cup chopped red onion
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 1/2 cups heavy cream
- 1 cup grated feta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add red onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
5. Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in chopped dill.
6. In a large bowl, whisk together heavy cream, grated feta cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, salt and black pepper.
7. Add cooked shrimp and spinach mixture to the bowl and stir until well combined.
8. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until hot and bubbling.
9. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious Shrimp and Spinach Casserole with Feta .

Warm Apple And Apricot Phyllo Purses Recipe

Ingredients:

* 1 sheet of frozen phyllo pastry, thawed
* 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter, melted
* 2 tablespoons of honey
* 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon
* 1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg
* 1/4 teaspoon of salt
* 2 cups of thinly sliced apples (peeled and cored)
* 1 cup of thinly sliced apricots
* 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
* 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley
* 1 egg, beaten
* Powdered sugar, for dusting

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together the melted butter, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
3. Lay the phyllo pastry flat on a clean surface and brush it with the butter mixture.
4. Arrange the sliced apples and apricots in the center of the phyllo pastry, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
5. Drizzle the lemon juice over the fruit and sprinkle with the chopped parsley.
6. Fold the phyllo pastry over the fruit, bringing the edges up and over to seal the purses.
7. Brush the sealed edges with the beaten egg.
8. Place the purses on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the fruit is tender.
9. Remove the purses from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. Dust the purses with powdered sugar and serve warm.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy Warm Apple And Apricot Phyllo Purses!

Baked Goat Cheese with Garden Lettuces Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 round of goat cheese (about 8 oz)
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup of chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley, chives, and basil)
- 2 cups of mixed garden lettuces
- 1/4 cup of balsamic vinaigrette

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, salt, and pepper.

3. Rub the mixture all over the goat cheese, making sure it is evenly coated.

4. Place the goat cheese in a small baking dish or oven-safe skillet.

5. Bake the goat cheese in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown and slightly softened.

6. Remove the goat cheese from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.

7. In the meantime, toss the mixed garden lettuces with the balsamic vinaigrette in a large bowl.

8. Serve the baked goat cheese with the garden lettuces on the side.

9. Enjoy!

New Potatoes with Spring Peas Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 pound new potatoes, washed and scrubbed
- 1 cup fresh or frozen spring peas
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley or chives, chopped (optional)

Instructions:

1. Cut the new potatoes into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large pot with enough water to cover them. Bring the water to a boil over high heat.
2. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer the potatoes for about 10-15 minutes, or until they are tender when poked with a fork.
3. Drain the potatoes and set them aside.
4. In the same pot, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
5. Add the spring peas to the pot and cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until they are heated through and slightly softened.
6. Season the peas with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Add the cooked potatoes to the pot with the peas and toss everything together to combine.
8. Serve the new potatoes with spring peas hot, garnished with fresh parsley or chives if desired. Enjoy!

Whole wheat spinach macaroni and cheese with broiled tomatoes is a delicious, healthy dinner that’s easy to make.
This dish combines the creaminess of traditional mac and cheese with the nutritional benefits of whole grain pasta and plenty of fresh spinach and tomatoes. It's a winner in our house!

Ingredients: 
- 1 pound whole wheat elbow macaroni
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter 
- 1/3 cup all-purpose flour 
- 2 cups milk 
- 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese 
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper 
- Salt, to taste 
- 4 large Fresh Tomatoes, chopped
- 2 cloves Garlic, minced 
- 2 tablespoons Olive oil 
- 10 oz fresh spinach leaves, washed and chopped 

Instructions: 
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease an 9x13 inch baking dish. 
2. Cook the macaroni according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the macaroni and set it aside. 
3. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk constantly for two minutes. Slowly pour in the milk, continue to whisk until smooth. Bring the mixture to a simmer, reduce the heat to low, and let it cook for about five minutes more, stirring occasionally, until thickened. 
4. Remove the pan from heat, turn off the stove and add salt, black pepper and shredded cheddar cheese, mix them well until cheese has completely melted. Stir in the cooked macaroni and set it aside. 
5. While the mac and cheese is cooking, prepare the tomatoes and spinach. Heat olive oil

Country Ham and Cheese Biscuits Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 6 tablespoons cold butter, cut into small cubes
- 3/4 cup milk
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup diced country ham
- Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the cold butter and using a pastry blender or two knives, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until it forms pea-sized crumbs.

3. Stir in the milk, shredded cheese, diced ham, and freshly ground black pepper until just combined.

4. Using an ice cream scoop or spoon, drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between each biscuit.

5. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown on top and firm to the touch.

6. Serve warm and enjoy your delicious Country Ham and Cheese Biscuits!

Basic Rice Soup Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup uncooked white rice
- 4 cups chicken or vegetable broth
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 carrots, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 2 cups cooked chicken or vegetable, chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 teaspoons dried thyme
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped (optional)

Instructions:

1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are softened.

2. Add the rice and stir to coat with the vegetables and oil. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.

3. Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and add the thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 18-20 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and the soup has thickened slightly.

4. Stir in the cooked chicken or vegetable and cook for an additional 5 minutes to heat through.

5. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired. Enjoy your delicious and comforting Basic Rice Soup!

Ricotta and Vanilla Bean Puddings Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup whole milk
- 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 large egg yolk
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Fresh berries or sliced fruit, for serving

Instructions:

1. In a medium saucepan, combine the milk, sugar, cornstarch, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the egg yolk until well combined. Return the saucepan to the heat and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.

3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract and ricotta cheese until well combined.

4. Divide the pudding mixture evenly among 4 individual serving dishes or ramekins.

5. Chill the puddings in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or until set.

6. Serve the puddings chilled, topped with fresh berries or sliced fruit. Enjoy!

Easy Jam with Strawberry Preserves Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup strawberry preserves
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup water
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Pinch of salt

Instructions:

1. In a medium saucepan, combine strawberry preserves, granulated sugar, water, lemon juice, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt.

2. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes.

3. Remove the saucepan from heat and let the jam cool for a few minutes.

4. Transfer the jam to a clean jar or container and let it cool completely at room temperature.

5. Once the jam has cooled, store it in the refrigerator. The jam will keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.

Enjoy your easy jam with strawberry preserves on toast, with yogurt, or as a topping for your favorite dessert.

Grampa Steve's Latkes Recipe

Ingredients:
1 large potato or 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and grated
2 eggs
1/4 cup of matzo meal (not self-rising)
1/8 teaspoon black pepper
2 tablespoons of sugar
1/4 teaspoon of salt
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
¼ tsp onion powder
3 tablespoons vegetable oil or sour cream
¼ cup of white wine or orange juice (optional)
2 green onions (optional) finely chopped
For serving: Applesauce, whipped cream, sour cream, horseradish sauce.

Fresh Carrot, Kale, Jicama, and Kidney Bean Salad Recipe

Ingredients:

* 2 medium carrots, peeled and grated
* 2 cups of kale leaves, chopped
* 1 medium jicama root, peeled and grated
* 1 can of kidney beans, rinsed and drained
* 1/4 cup of chopped fresh cilantro
* Juice of 1 lime
* 2 tablespoons of olive oil
* 1 tablespoon of honey
* Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. In a large bowl, combine the grated carrots, chopped kale, and grated jicama.
2. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper.
3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
4. Add the rinsed and drained kidney beans to the salad and toss to combine.
5. Garnish the salad with chopped fresh cilantro.
6. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Enjoy your Fresh Carrot, Kale, Jicama, and Kidney Bean Salad! This refreshing and nutritious salad is perfect for a healthy lunch or as a side dish for dinner. The combination of grated carrots, chopped kale, and grated jicama adds a satisfying crunch to the salad, while the kidney beans provide a filling protein boost. The lime juice, olive oil, and honey dressing ties everything together with a tangy and sweet flavor.

Tomato and Zucchini Primavera Recipe

Ingredients: 
-4 medium sized tomatoes, diced 
-2 medium zucchinis, sliced into strips 
-1 small onion, chopped 
-3 cloves garlic, minced 
-Olive oil 
-Salt 
-Pepper 
-Fresh basil leaves, torn 
-Grated Parmesan cheese 

Directions: 

1) Start by heating olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 

2) Add the chopped onions and cook until they become translucent, about 5 minutes. 

3) Next, add the minced garlic and saute for another minute. 

4) Add the sliced zucchinis to the skillet and sprinkle some salt and pepper on them. Cook for about 7 minutes or until zucchinis start to soften. 

5) Add diced tomatoes to the skillet and mix everything together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

6) Reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10 minutes or until all vegetables are cooked through. 

7) Remove from heat and toss in freshly torn basil leaves. Serve hot and top each serving with grated Parmesan cheese. Enjoy your delicious and healthy Tomato and Zucchini Primavera!

Easy Microwavable Low-Cal Strawberry Preserves Recipe
Ingredients:
- 1 cup fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- Optional: a few drops of vanilla extract or cinnamon oil for flavoring
Instructions:
1. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the sliced strawberries, granulated sugar, and lemon juice. Stir well to coat the fruit with the sugar and lemon juice.
2. Cover the bowl tightly with plastic wrap, leaving a small vent at the top to allow steam to escape.
3. Microwave on high for 5-7 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until the strawberries are soft and the mixture has thickened into a syrup.
4. If desired, add in a few drops of vanilla extract or cinnamon oil for additional flavoring. Stir well to incorporate.
5. Allow the preserves to cool slightly before serving or storing in an airtight container in the fridge for up to one week. Enjoy your easy microwavable low-cal strawberry preserves!

Very Juicy Chicken Karaage Recipe

Ingredients:

- 8 pieces chicken drumsticks or thighs (or a mix of both)
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon onion powder
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
- 1 egg
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- Vegetable oil, for frying

Instructions:

1. In a shallow dish, mix together the flour, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
2. In a separate dish, whisk together the buttermilk, egg, and soy sauce.
3. Dredge each piece of chicken in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess. Then dip the chicken in the buttermilk mixture, making sure it is well coated. Finally, dredge the chicken again in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
4. Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a deep skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat until it reaches a temperature of 350°F (180°C).
5. Carefully add the chicken to the hot oil, being sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the chicken for about 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until it is golden brown and cooked through.
6. Use a slotted spoon to remove the chicken from the oil and place it on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
7. Serve the chicken karaage hot with your favorite dipping sauce, and enjoy!

Veggie Burger Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed 
- ½ cup cooked brown rice
- ¼ cup chopped red onion 
- 2 carrots, grated 
- 1 zucchini, grated
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste 
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce 
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder 
- 1 teaspoon paprika 
- Salt and pepper to taste 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- burger buns, lettuce, tomato and other desired toppings 

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mash together the black beans and brown rice until well combined.
2. Stir in the chopped red onion, grated carrots and zucchini, tomato paste, soy sauce, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. 
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.  
4. Once hot, use your hands to form the bean mixture into patties. 
5. Place the patties in the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. 
6. While the veggie burgers are cooking, assemble the rest of your burger by putting buns on plates, adding lettuce and any other desired toppings. 
7. When the patties are done, place them on top of the buns and serve immediately. Enjoy!

Ingredients:

Spelt Dough Recipe:

Ingredients:
- 2 cups of spelt flour
- 1 package active dry yeast
- 2 tablespoons of honey or maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup warm water
- ¼ cup vegetable oil

Instructions:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spelt flour, active dry yeast, honey or maple syrup, and salt. Mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.

2. Slowly pour in the warm water while stirring the mixture with your hands or a wooden spoon until it forms a soft dough.

3. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. If the dough is too sticky, add more flour as needed.

4. Place the kneaded dough into a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm place for about an hour or until doubled in size.

5. After the first rise, punch down the dough and shape into desired form. This can be rolled out into a flat sheet, formed into a round loaf, or braided into a challah.

6. Allow the shaped dough to rise again for another 30-45 minutes until nearly doubled in size.

7. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Bake the risen dough for 25-35 minutes depending on its size and thickness, until golden brown and cooked through.

8. Remove from oven and allow to cool before slicing and serving. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 pound of ground chuck beef
- Salt, to taste
- Black pepper, to taste
- Garlic powder, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Liquid smoke, to taste (optional)
- Olive oil or cooking spray

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 250°F.
2. Season the ground chuck beef with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and Worcestershire sauce. If you want a smoky flavor, add liquid smoke as well. Mix the seasoning thoroughly into the meat.
3. Heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the beef mixture to the skillet and cook it for about 5 minutes or until browned on all sides. Make sure the beef is evenly distributed throughout the pan.
4. Once the beef has been browned on both sides, transfer it to a baking dish that can fit the entire batch. Bake the beef in the preheated oven for about 3 hours. The bake time may vary depending on the shape and size of your roasting pan, so keep an eye on it periodically and adjust the timing if necessary.
5. After 3 hours of baking, remove the beef from the oven and let it rest for another 10-15 minutes before slicing it up and serving. You can also use this Joe's Swiss Roast as a base ingredient for other recipes like sandwiches or salads by shaving or chopping it finely. Enjoy!

"C’Est Magnifique" French Toast Recipe

Ingredients:
- 6 thick slices of bread (preferably day-old bread)
- 2 large eggs
- 2/3 cup of heavy cream
- 2 tablespoons of sugar
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg
- Salt to taste
- Butter or oil for cooking
- Powdered sugar or maple syrup for serving (optional)

Instructions:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt until well combined.

2. Heat a large non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and add a small amount of butter or oil to coat the bottom of the pan.

3. Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, making sure to coat both sides evenly.

4. Place the bread in the hot skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.

5. Repeat with the remaining bread slices, adding more butter or oil to the pan as needed.

6. Serve the French toast warm, topped with a dusting of powdered sugar or a drizzle of maple syrup if desired.

7. Enjoy your delicious "C’Est Magnifique" French Toast!

1 cup butter, softened

1 cup brown sugar

1 egg

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

1 teaspoon baking soda

1 teaspoon salt

2 cups flour

1 cup chopped walnuts

1 cup butterscotch chips

1 cup white chocolate chips

1 cup sweetened flaked coconut

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in a small bowl of hot water. Stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the salt, flour, walnuts, butterscotch chips, white chocolate chips, and coconut. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.

Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Serves: 3–4 total (2 eggs per serving)

Total Time: 1 hour

Ingredients:

2 poblano chiles

1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese

4 eggs, lightly beaten

2 tablespoons finely chopped onion

2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro

salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:

Preheat the oven broiler.

Put the poblano chiles on a baking sheet and place under the broiler for 10 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins are blackened and blistered. Cover with plastic wrap for 10 minutes to allow the chiles to steam. Peel off the charred skin and remove the stems, ribs, and seeds. Cut the chiles into strips and set aside.

In a 9-inch pie pan, scatter the chile strips. Top with the cheese, eggs, onion, and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.

Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes or until eggs are set and cheese begins to brown.

#### A Typical Oaxacan Meal

A typical Oaxacan meal is eaten in four or five courses (Plate 6). The first order of business is to take a drink. Most Oaxacans drink either a hot beverage, such as cocoa, or a cold beverage, such as agua de jamaica or agua de horchata (Plate 7). After the drink is poured, everyone eats a sweet bread roll called bolillo, which is soft and slightly sweet. Bolillo can be eaten without anything on it in order to clean the palate in preparation for the dishes that will come later in the meal.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray.
1. Set out the filling: In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar and ground cinnamon. Set aside.
2. For the phyllo dough: In a 9x13-inch pan, lay one sheet of phyllo dough so that the edges hang over the sides of the pan. Brush the phyllo dough with some of the melted butter. Lay another phyllo dough sheet in the pan the same way.
3. Repeat the layering and brushing process. (Use about 6 phyllo sheets, brushing each sheet with butter.) Pour the filling over the phyllo dough. Fold the phyllo over the filling to seal. (The baklava will be in 4 long rows; 2 filled rows on the top and bottom, and 2 blank rows on each side.)
4. Next, cut through the phyllo with a sharp knife so that the baklava is in separate squares. This is very important. If you don't cut through the phyllo, when you remove the baklava from the pan, it will crumble into pieces since the filling expands in the oven and will break the phyllo dough.
5. Top the baklava with remaining 4 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each sheet with the melted butter. Fold up the edges of the phyllo sheets so they are flush with the top of the pan and brush with more butter. Place the baklava in the preheated oven and bake for about 40 minutes, or until golden brown. Allow to cool; then dust with the cinnamon and sugar mixture and cut into squares to serve.
N.B. These are my own, very rough, translations of those two recipes:
1. In a small bowl, mix sugar and cinnamon.
2. Lay 1 pastry sheet in the bottom of the tin; spread with melted butter. Lay another sheet on top.
3. Repeat (6-8 times).
4. Lay out filling, then put 4 more sheets over top.
5. Cut into squares through all the phyllo with a knife.
6. Brush with butter again, and put in oven

Julia Child's Caramel Custard

Prep Time: 10 minutes

Cook Time: 1 hour

Total Time: 1 hour 10 minutes

Yield: 6 servings

Ingredients

1 cup sugar

1 cup water

1 cup heavy cream

1 cup whole milk

1 vanilla bean, split lengthwise

6 large egg yolks

Directions

1. In a small saucepan, combine the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves. Continue to boil, without stirring, until the mixture turns a deep amber color, about 5 minutes.

2. Remove from the heat and carefully add the cream and milk (the mixture will bubble up). Stir until smooth.

3. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean and add them to the saucepan.

4. In a large bowl, whisk the egg yolks until smooth. Gradually whisk in the cream mixture.

5. Pour the mixture into 6 (6-ounce) ramekins. Place the ramekins in a large baking pan. Add enough hot water to the pan to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.

6. Bake in the preheated oven until the custards are just set, about 45 minutes. Remove the ramekins from the water bath and let cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 4 hours.

7. To serve, run a knife around the edge of each custard and invert onto a serving plate.

 _Format. A recipe with multiple ingredients, in this case coffee, hot water, salt, a third teaspoon of hot water, sugar, and milk, is formatted in what would look like a table, but with only three columns, in this case, ingredients, quantities, and notes. A recipe may be quite complex, and it is a good idea to use multiple table elements, each identifying the recipe, the cooking process, and the individual ingredients. In the above example, it would seem appropriate to have a table element for the recipe itself, another for the instructions, and a third for the ingredients._ Figure 7-6 shows an example of a recipe element.

 _Cooking process. A recipe element with several ingredients requires a "cooking process" so the ingredients can be mixed and prepared properly._ Figure 7-7 shows an example of a cooking process element.

 _Ingredient properties. When each ingredient has its own property, it will be easier for users to understand the quantities needed for each component of a recipe._ Figure 7-8 shows an example of an ingredient. The recipe calls for a cup, plus a half-inch, of milk. The half-inch isn't part of the cup, but rather is its own value. So the cup is an amount and the half-inch is an increment with its own property. It is a good idea to make sure the ingredient properties can be edited.

If you're looking for easy breakfast ideas, look no further than this fresh-tasting recipe. Eggs are quickly poached, then served over spicy sautéed eggplant and tomatoes. Great when served with toast.

INGREDIENTS

4 ripe tomatoes, cut into wedges

½ large sweet onion, chopped

½ small red bell pepper, chopped

1 teaspoon red pepper flakes

½ teaspoon salt

½ teaspoon black pepper

1 cup water

1 fresh eggplant, peeled and thinly sliced

4 eggs

1 tablespoon olive oil

2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley

  Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

  Arrange tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper.

  Place water in a skillet over medium-high heat until boiling.

  Add eggplant and cook until wilted and water has evaporated, 5 to 8 minutes.

  Carefully transfer eggplant to a 9x13-inch baking dish and top with tomato mixture.

  Place egg onto tomato mixture and bake 15 to 16 minutes or until whites are cooked.

  Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat for 1 minute.

  Carefully crack four eggs, one at a time, into pan.

  Cover and cook 1 minute or until egg whites are completely set and yolks start to thicken.

  Using a slotted spoon, transfer tomatoes and vegetables to plates.

  Top with eggs and sprinkle with parsley.

This recipe illustrates the way that recipes are structured. It gives directions about what to do. There is no implied intent in this recipe, no subtext. But the same is not true of most non-recipes. Because most of the things we make in life are "situations" rather than "dishes," they are not built from distinct ingredients arranged in distinct steps. Instead, they are made from the whole of experience. They are made from feeling as well as fact. They are made from the subtext of words and from the nuanced shadings of actions. They are not built up bit by bit from simple instructions, but are made by using all of what we know.

I have a question about Sicilian Casseroles, or Sicilian Broccoli Casseroles, from allrecipes.com. Do you ever substitute ingredients in a "broccoli" casserole? My family always substitutes ingredients for a broccoli casserole, but to me, it's a "broccoli" casserole. We use a lot of ham, broccoli, and cheese, but we always substitute all other vegetables and meats, and it's still a "broccoli" casserole with all the other things that you would normally put in a "broccoli" casserole. Do you notice that?
Yes I do notice that you tend to use a lot of the same ingredients. But in our family we tend to make everything and anything, and we never use a recipe, and we have our own specialties. You can't have one without the other, we make both, but in our house it's the other.
My mother always cooked with recipes that we made ourselves and we only made one type of dish. We always used our own specialties, but with our own specialties it was "my dish." It wasn't our specialty.
You can't have one without the other. It doesn't matter what kind of dish it is.

Now that you have a more specific understanding of what you're looking for and what you're trying to avoid, read each ingredient that the recipe calls for and determine if it is safe or unsafe for you to ingest. As you identify ingredients that could potentially harm your health, you must look beyond recipes for new ideas, as well.

It's highly unlikely that you'll find an ingredient in a recipe that is absolutely safe or unhealthy. However, most ingredients can be classified as borderline (safe/unsafe) for many people. Ingredients like onion, tomato, garlic, etc., are typically safe for most people and should be considered borderline. There are also ingredients that are completely safe or completely unsafe for most people, including salt, sugar, milk, cheese, and so on.

By combining foods that are borderline for most people with foods that are completely safe and then taking steps to eliminate or substitute ingredients that could harm your health with something similar that is safe, you would have a recipe that would be safe for most people. Most recipes have several ingredients that are borderline or safe for you and others that are not. Use this as a first step in determining if a meal that you are about to eat is safe or not.

The Risotto
The Squash Rice
(This dish can easily be made vegan by omitting the shrimp)
Butternut Squash "Rice" Risotto With Shrimp & Peas Recipe
This unique low-carb risotto is made using mashed up butternut squash instead of arborio rice. And it's easy to make on the stovetop or in a rice cooker.
2 pounds butternut squash peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 yellow onion diced
2 tablespoons olive oil plus more for finishing
1/4 cup white rice flour
4 cups low-sodium chicken broth plus 2 additional cups for finishing
2/3 cup dry white wine
6 ounces peeled and deveined cooked shrimp
1/3 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese plus more for finishing
2 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into eight pieces
1 cup fresh or frozen peas
Add butternut squash, 1/2 cup water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a large pot. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium and cook until squash is fork tender, about 12 minutes. Drain excess liquid.
In a small frying pan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion until slightly browned, about 8 minutes.
Reserve 4 cooked cubes of butternut squash to use in garnishing the dish at the end.
Put the mashed squash into a medium-sized bowl and stir in rice flour.
In a separate pot, combine 2 cups of chicken broth with the wine and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring often.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook until butter is melted and oil is shimmering.
Add flour-coated squash to a hot pan, season with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring sometimes.
Add 1 cup of warm liquid broth at a time and rice mixture. Continue to stir until liquid broth is absorbed by the squash and a creamy consistency is formed,

Duck Dumplings  
Ingredients:

6 cups duck stock

1/2 cup chopped celery

1/4 cup dried mushrooms, chopped

18 to 24 wonton wrappers

1 egg, lightly beaten

pepper to taste

Directions:

1. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add celery; cook and stir until tender. Add mushrooms and duck stock; bring to a boil. Place 18 to 24 wonton wrappers in the water. Meanwhile, combine egg yolk and white.

2. Boil wontons 15 minutes, or until cooked. Drain, dry and cut into strips. Add wonton strips to boiling stock mixture and reduce heat to low.

3. Brush edges of wontons with egg mixture. Working quickly, turn over wonton strip so the bottom side is on top. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with pepper. Refrigerate until completely cooled. Serve topped with egg strips as a garnish.

"Lightly Spiced Plum Jam

"This is a very simple recipe for a lightly spiced plum jam. It is a great way to use up plums that are just a little too ripe to eat fresh.

"Ingredients

"1 pound plums, pitted and chopped

"1 cup sugar

"1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon

"1/2 teaspoon ground cloves

"1/2 teaspoon ground ginger

"1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg

"Directions

"1. Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture thickens, about 30 minutes.

"2. Pour into sterilized jars and seal. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 6 months."

Ingredients:
- 1 baguette, sliced into 1-inch rounds
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup cubed day-old bread
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar

Instructions:

1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.

2. In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.

3. Brush both sides of the baguette slices with the garlic oil mixture.

4. Place the baguette slices on the grill and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until grill marks appear and the bread is lightly toasted.

5. In a large bowl, combine cherry tomatoes, cubed day-old bread, and shredded mozzarella cheese.

6. Add the grilled baguette slices to the bowl and toss everything together.

7. Let the panzanella sit for 5-10 minutes to allow the bread to absorb the flavors.

8. Just before serving, stir in the chopped fresh basil and drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

9. Serve immediately and enjoy your grilled garlic bread panzanella!

Ingredients:
- 6 cups of popped corn
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup chocolate chips
- 1 tsp vegetable oil

Instructions:

1. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine peanut butter, honey, and vegetable oil.
2. Microwave the mixture for 15-20 seconds until smooth.
3. Add the chocolate chips to the mixture and stir until melted.
4. Add the popped corn to the bowl and stir until evenly coated with the chocolate drizzle.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spread the coated popcorn onto it.
6. Place the baking sheet in the fridge for 10-15 minutes until the chocolate is set.
7. Once set, break the popcorn into smaller pieces and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Peanut Butter Chocolate Drizzle Popcorn!

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 6 cups peeled, cored, and thinly sliced apples (about 6 medium apples)
- 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

3. Add the melted butter and egg to the dry ingredients and mix until well combined. Stir in the vanilla extract.

4. Spread half of the dough evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.

5. Arrange the sliced apples over the dough in an even layer.

6. In a small bowl, mix together the oats, 1/4 cup flour, brown sugar, and melted butter until well combined.

7. Sprinkle the oat mixture evenly over the apples.

8. Drop spoonfuls of the remaining dough over the top of the apple mixture.

9. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the apples are tender.

10. Cool completely before slicing into bars and serving. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 tbsp. ginger-garlic paste
- 1 tsp. cumin seeds
- 1 tsp. coriander powder
- 1 tsp. turmeric powder
- 1 tsp. red chili powder
- Salt, to taste
- 2 tbsp. oil
- Fresh cilantro, chopped
- Bread slices, toasted

Directions:
1. Heat oil in a kadai (wok) and add cumin seeds.
2. Once the cumin seeds start to splutter, add sliced onions and sauté till they turn golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
4. Add sliced mushrooms and sauté for 5-7 minutes or until they turn tender.
5. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and sauté for a minute.
6. Add a tbsp. of water and cover the kadai with a lid. Cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat.
7. Once the mushrooms are cooked, remove the lid and cook the mixture for another 2-3 minutes till the excess moisture evaporates.
8. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with toasted bread slices.
9. Enjoy your delicious Kadai Mushroom!

Ingredients:
- 1 lb large prawns, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- Salt & pepper to taste
- Ice cubes
- 3/4 cup thousand island dressing (or mayonnaise)
- Lettuce leaves
- Tomatoes, sliced into rounds
- Celery sticks or cress
Instructions:
1. Bring a pot of water to boil with salt added in it. Add the cleaned Prawn's tail first then reduce heat let them cook until they turn pink remove from hotwater put on ice this stops cooking process 
2. In another bowl mix together Lemon Juice Thousand Island Dressing(mayo),Salt&Pepper set aside.3. Take 4 glasses divide lettuce at bottom,then tomato slices next add cooked chilled shrimp place evenly over tomatoes pour sauce mixture generously allover shrimps now top each glass equally divided celery stick /cresses you can use cocktail saucers as well instead of serving directly in drinking Glasses.Serve immediately enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- Butter and jam for filling

Instructions:

1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, milk, and salt until smooth.

2. Add the vegetable oil, sugar, and vanilla extract to the batter and whisk until combined.

3. Allow the batter to rest for at least 30 minutes.

4. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a thin layer of butter.

5. Ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the pan and swirl to spread it evenly.

6. Cook the crepe until it is golden brown on one side, then flip and cook the other side for another minute.

7. Repeat until all the batter is used up.

8. Spread butter and jam on one crepe, then stack another crepe on top.

9. Repeat until all the crepes are used up, then slice the stacked crepes into wedges.

10. Serve the Crepe Nonats warm with additional butter and jam on the side if desired. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 loaf of Italian bread, sliced in half lengthwise 
- 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese  
- 16 oz. sour cream   
- 10 oz can diced tomatoes with green chilies (drained)    
 -1/2 cup chopped onion 
 – 3 cloves garlic minced
 	 	 
 
 
 Instructions:

 Preheat oven to 350°F 

 In small bowl mix together the drained Tomatoes and Green Chili's, Onion & Garlic. Spread this mixture evenly over both halves of your loaves then sprinkle Cheese on top let it melt while baking covered at 375 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown! Serve warm with chips or crackers Enjoy :)

Ingredients:
- 1 lb pork tenderloin
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1 tsp olive oil
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 tsp garlic powder

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375°F.

2. In a small bowl, mix together the dried cranberries, chopped onion, olive oil, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder.

3. Cut the pork tenderloin into 1-inch thick slices.

4. Place the pork slices in a baking dish and spread the cranberry-onion mixture evenly over the pork.

5. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through.

6. Serve hot and enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 4 chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- Salt and pepper
- 1/4 cup chicken broth
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tbsp cornstarch
- 1 tsp sesame oil

Instructions:

1. Cut the chicken breasts into thin strips.

2. Heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium-high heat.

3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, then add it to the hot pan.

4. Cook the chicken for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently, until it is cooked through and browned on all sides.

5. In a small bowl, whisk together the chicken broth, soy sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil.

6. Pour the sauce over the chicken in the pan and stir well to coat.

7. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened.

8. Remove from heat and serve hot over rice or in a bento box for lunch.

Ingredients:
- 1 pound spaghetti pasta 
- 4 tbsp. unsalted butter  
- 2 oz black truffle, finely chopped   
- ⅓ cup dry white wine    
- ¾ tsp minced garlic     
- Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste 

Instructions:            

        1. Bring salted water to boil in large pot over high heat

Ingredients:
- 1 pre-madeflatbread
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red pepper, sliced
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Balsamic glaze, to drizzle (optional)

Instructions:
1. Preheat your grill to medium heat.
2. Brush the flatbread with olive oil and place it on the grill.
3. Grill the flatbread for 2-3 minutes on each side until it's lightly charred.
4. In a bowl, toss the sliced zucchini, red pepper, and red onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
5. Place the vegetables on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes, flipping them halfway through.
6. Once the vegetables are tender and the flatbread is charred, remove them from the grill.
7. Transfer the grilled vegetables onto the flatbread.
8. Drizzle balsamic glaze on top of the vegetables, if desired.
9. Slice the flatbread into portions and serve warm. Enjoy!

Ingredients:

- 6 cups Rice Krispies cereal
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/2 cup honey
- 1/2 cup coconut oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon sea salt

Instructions:

1. Grease an 8x8 inch pan with cooking spray or butter.

2. In a large pot, melt the coconut oil over low heat.

3. Add the peanut butter and honey to the pot and stir until smooth.

4. Add the vanilla extract, sea salt, and 3 cups of Rice Krispies to the pot and stir until well combined.

5. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and press down with a spatula to evenly distribute the mixture.

6. Sprinkle the remaining 3 cups of Rice Krispies over the top of the mixture and press down lightly to adhere.

7. Allow the squares to cool completely before cutting into 16 equal squares.

8. Store the squares in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

Enjoy your delicious Rice Krispies Squares without the added sugar!

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground chicken
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 4 hamburger buns

Instructions:

1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat or heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, red onion, red and green bell peppers, cilantro, salt, and black pepper. Mix well with your hands until all ingredients are incorporated.

3. Divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a patty about 1-inch thick.

4. Brush the olive oil onto the grill grates or grill pan to prevent sticking. Place the chicken burgers onto the grill and cook for 5-6 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.

5. While the chicken burgers are cooking, lightly toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.

6. Once the chicken burgers are cooked, place them onto the toasted hamburger buns and serve immediately. Enjoy your delicious homemade chicken burgers with fresh bell peppers, onion, and cilantro!

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 3/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 tsp peppermint extract
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease four 6-ounce ramekins with butter and dust with cocoa powder, tapping out any excess.

2. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the melted butter, sugar, eggs, and peppermint extract until smooth.

3. Add the flour, cocoa powder, and salt to the wet mixture and stir until just combined.

4. Fold in the chocolate chips.

5. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared ramekins, filling each about 3/4 full.

6. Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and bake for 12-14 minutes, or until the edges are set but the center is still soft and gooey.

7. Let the cakes cool for a minute or two before carefully inverting onto a plate.

8. Serve immediately with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of crushed candy canes, if desired.

Easy Jam with Strawberry Preserves

Ingredients:
- 1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and halved
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 (7-ounce) pouch liquid pectin

Instructions:

1. In a large pot, combine strawberries and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, and then reduce heat to medium-high and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

2. Add sugar to the pot and bring the mixture to a rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil hard for 1 minute.

3. Remove the pot from the heat and quickly stir in the liquid pectin. Continue stirring for 2 minutes.

4. Skim off any foam from the top of the jam.

5. Ladle the jam into clean jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rim of jars clean and place lid and ring on top, tightening to fingertip tight.

6. Process filled jars in a boiling water bath canner for 10 minutes (adjusting the time depending on your altitude). Remove jars from canner and let cool undisturbed for 24 hours. Check lid seals, and store properly.

Enjoy your homemade Easy Jam with Strawberry Preserves!

- 2 zucchinis, sliced lengthwise 
- 4 red bell peppers, seeded and cut into strips 
- 8 oz cherry tomatoes (or regular sized ones halved) 
- 6 cloves of garlic, minced or pressed 
 - Salt & pepper to taste

   2. In medium bowl mix together 3 tablespoons extra virgin Olive Oil,3 tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar(optional),minced Garlic salt&pepper set aside as dressing

Arrange half each in bottom layer Eggplants Zuchini Red Bell Peppers Tomatoes on top drizzle one third over all Dressing from step two repeat layers ending with last bit off vegetables then pour rest if any leftover dressings evenly across surface cover tightly foil paper bake 45 minutes at 200 Celsius /400 Fahrenheit remove foils continue cooking another 15minutes till golden brown serve hot Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 4 lamb shanks
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 4 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 carrots, peeled and chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 2 parsnips, peeled and chopped
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1 tsp smoked paprika
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 cup red wine
- 4 cups beef broth
- 2 bay leaves
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 325°F.

2. Season lamb shanks with salt and black pepper.

3. In a large Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown lamb shanks on all sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from pot and set aside.

4. In the same pot, sauté onion, garlic, carrots, celery, and parsnips until softened, about 5-7 minutes.

5. Add thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the pot and cook for another minute.

6. Pour in red wine and bring to a boil, scraping the bottom of the pot to loosen any browned bits. Cook for 5 minutes or until reduced by half.

7. Add diced tomatoes, beef broth, and bay leaves. Bring to a simmer.

8. Return lamb shanks to the pot, making sure they are submerged in the liquid. If necessary, add more broth.

9. Cover the pot and transfer to the oven. Cook for 2-2.5 hours or until lamb shanks are tender and falling off the bone.

10. Remove pot from oven and discard bay leaves.

11. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley. Enjoy your delicious lamb shank stew!

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup dried cherries, chopped
- 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray or butter.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

3. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.

4. Gradually mix in the dry ingredients until just combined. Fold in the chopped cherries and chocolate chips.

5. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.

6. Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the loaf to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

7. Once the loaf has cooled, slice and serve. Enjoy!

Apricot Breakfast Rolls Recipe

Ingredients:

- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup dried apricots, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup golden raisins

Instructions:

1. Heat the milk, butter, sugar, salt, cinnamon, and cardamom in a saucepan until the butter has melted. Remove from heat.

2. Add the flour to the mixture and stir until a dough forms.

3. Let the dough cool for about 10 minutes.

4. Add the chopped apricots and raisins to the dough and mix well.

5. Preheat the oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

6. Roll the dough into small balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet.

7. Bake the rolls for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

8. Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

9. Enjoy your delicious Apricot Breakfast Rolls!
