Ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 4 large eggs, beaten
- 1/2 cup cotija cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.

2. Add the onion, garlic, jalapeno pepper, and red bell pepper to the skillet and sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.

3. Add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir to combine with the vegetables. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.

4. Push the rice to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix them into the rice.

5. Add the cotija cheese and cilantro to the rice mixture and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

6. Remove the skillet from the heat and serve the migas fried rice hot. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups cake flour
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 6 egg yolks
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 2 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 tsp cream of tartar
- 8 egg whites
- 1 tsp salt

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 325°F. Grease a 10-inch tube pan and dust with flour.

2. In a large mixing bowl, sift together the cake flour and 1 cup of sugar.

3. In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks until pale yellow and frothy. Gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and continue beating until the mixture becomes thick and pale.

4. Add the milk and vanilla extract to the egg yolk mixture and whisk until well combined.

5. Gradually fold the sifted flour mixture into the egg yolk mixture until there are no lumps.

6. In a separate, clean mixing bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form.

7. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the batter in three parts, making sure not to deflate the egg whites.

8. Pour the batter into the prepared tube pan and tap the pan gently on the counter to remove any air bubbles.

9. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

10. Invert the cake onto a wire rack and let it cool completely before removing from the pan.

11. Serve and enjoy your delicious vanilla chiffon cake!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup cream
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
- 8 oz semi-sweet chocolate

Instructions:

1. In a large saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar, cream, and vanilla extract. Heat on medium-high until the mixture comes to a boil, stirring occasionally.

2. Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in rolled oats and chopped walnuts.

3. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spoon out tablespoon-sized portions of the oat mixture onto the sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Flatten each portion slightly with a spatula.

4. Place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to allow the logs to harden.

5. In the meantime, break the semi-sweet chocolate into small pieces and place it in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the chocolate in the microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring after each interval until the chocolate is completely melted and smooth.

6. Remove the logs from the refrigerator and use a toothpick to dip one end of each log into the melted chocolate, swirling it around to coat. Place the chocolate-dipped logs back onto the parchment paper.

7. Return the logs to the refrigerator for another 10-15 minutes to allow the chocolate to harden.

8. Store the chocolate-dipped butterscotch logs in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week, or in the freezer for up to two months.

 Pour the mixture into a greased 8x8 inch baking dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the grits are cooked through. Serve hot. Enjoy!

Ingredients:

• 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes

• 1 tsp salt

• 1/2 tsp black pepper

• 2 tbsp olive oil

• 1 onion, chopped

• 3 garlic cloves, minced

• 1 tbsp tomato paste

• 1/2 cup red wine

• 3 cups beef broth

• 2 carrots, sliced

• 2 celery stalks, sliced

• 1 tsp cinnamon

• 1 tbsp cornstarch

• 2 tbsp cold water

• 2 oranges

• 1/4 cup freshly chopped parsley

• 1/4 cup freshly chopped mint

• 1/4 cup freshly chopped basil

• 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Instructions:

1. Season the beef with salt and pepper.

2. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.

3. Add onion and garlic to the pot and cook until tender. Add tomato paste and cook for another minute.

4. Add red wine to the pot and scrape the bottom to remove any browned bits. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the wine is reduced by half.

5. Add beef broth, carrots, celery, cinnamon, and browned beef to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender.

6. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with cold water. Add to the stew and stir until thickened.

7. For the orange gremolata, zest the oranges and place the zest in a bowl. Add parsley, mint, basil, and Parmesan cheese. Mix well.

8. Serve the stew hot with a sprinkle of orange gremolata on top.
